condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Parents, communities, civil society and government have increased capacity to provide child- and gender-sensitive care and support to children at risk

description.narrative: UNICEF South Africa leveraged partnerships which led to intensified commitments and visibility of programmes on care and support to children. Through strategic partnerships, the Global Child and Youth Care Conference showcased the importance of Child and Youth Care as part of the Social Service for Child Protection in South Africa. UNICEF continued to support the Department of Social Development in the implementation of positive parenting programmes. Key advocacy initiatives called for increased male involvement as a catalyst for more equitable caregiving and violence prevention. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2020
